title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9000.3 - Appeal from denial of access to records
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9000.3 - Appeal from denial of access to records

State Regulations
(a) Any person who is denied access to any
record may, within 30 days of such denial, appeal the denial in writing to: President, Battery Park City Authority, One World Financial Center, New York, NY 10281. (b) The time for deciding
an appeal shall commence upon receipt of a written appeal identifying: (1)
the date of the request for
records; (2)
the records that were
denied; and
(3)
the name and return
address of the applicant. (c) The president of the authority shall
inform the appellant and the Committee on Public Access to Records, in writing, of the authority's determination within seven business days of an
appeal. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
9000.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
